{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2504.21378v1", "title": "The polynomial growth of effective resistances in one-dimensional
  critical long-range percolation", "summary": "We study the critical long-range percolation on $\mathbb{Z}$, where an edge
connects $i$ and $j$ independently with probability
$1-\exp\{-\beta\int_i^{i+1}\int_j^{j+1}|u-v|^{-2}{\rm d} u{\rm d} v\}$ for
$|i-j|>1$ for some fixed $\beta>0$ and with probability 1 for $|i-j|=1$.
Viewing this as a random electric network where each edge has a unit
conductance, we show that the effective resistances from 0 to $[-n,n]^c$ and
from the interval $[-n,n]$ to $[-2n,2n]^c$ (conditioned on no edge joining
$[-n,n]$ and $[-2n,2n]^c$) both grow like $n^{\delta(\beta)}$ for some
$\delta(\beta)\in (0,1)$.", "main_category": "math.PR", "categories": "math.PR", "published": "2025-04-30T07:28:00Z"}
